result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wesley Soto-Gonzalez in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Wesley Soto-Gonzalez in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court, defendant Wesley Soto-Gonzalez not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests new date.    Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 26.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Case to tag along with 15CF5472.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Ann M Heaps in court, defendant Wesley Soto-Gonzalez not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

15RM053876  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
12/02/2015

Defendant Wesley Soto-Gonzalez in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Yvon Roustan. CMC. NO FILE IN COURT. Discussions of Justice Point Report placed on the record. Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse. Case remains set for a Scheduling Conference on 12/14/2015 at 8:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION report; Positive Test.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Soto-Gonzalez in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Defendant Soto-Gonzalez in custody.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24. All parties are notified that effective 12-14-15 this case will be assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21, in Room 622 of the Courthouse.
Sworn as interpreter: Dawn Maldonado.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Wesley Soto-Gonzalez not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant serving a sentence on a commitment.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY KOHL'S DEPARTMENT STORE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Wesley Soto-Gonzalez in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Wesley Soto-Gonzalez in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant HAS A LOWER PENDING CASE AND is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
